meta_description: World Awareness Children's Museum in Glens Falls, NY has a mission to inspire curiosity, understanding and appreciation of cultural diversity.
hours_text:
## WORLD AWARENESS CHILDREN’S MUSEUM & GO!

Where Children Discover the World

An interactive, hands-on Children’s Museum located in Downtown Glens Falls, New York.

[View Calendar](https://worldchildrensmuseum.org/events-calendar/)[Support WACM](https://worldchildrensmuseum.org/support/)

## Summer Programs

# Plan Your Trip

**Admission**

**$7.00** : Adults and children  
Children under 12 months are free  
**Free Admission for Members**  
**Military discount:** $4 per person for up to 4 people with a military ID  
**Families on EBT or SNAP:** $1 per person for up to 4 people with EBT/SNAP card and government ID

**Closed on the following holidays:**  
New Year’s Day  
Memorial Day  
Independence Day  
Labor Day  
Thanksgiving Day  
Christmas Day

We participate in the **_[Museums for All](https://museums4all.org) _**program that offers free or reduced admissions to those who qualify.

[](https://museums4all.org)

**We’re so glad you’re coming to visit.**

Open for group tours or educational programs year round (reservations required).

Call [518-793-2773](tel:518-793-2773) or [email](mailto:info@worldchildrensmuseum.org) to schedule a group tour!

Hours

**September – June:**  
Thursday – Monday  
10am – 3pm

admission_text:
Business Membership

Help support our mission of bringing our diverse world to children



# Business Membership

Your business can help support our mission of bringing our diverse world to children by purchasing a Business Passport and/or sponsoring initiatives.

### Benefits:

  * Free admission for up to 5 people when presenting membership card
  * Free or reduced priced workshops when presenting membership card
  * 10% discount in Museum store when presenting membership card
  * Invitations to exclusive member events
  * Free jumps in our Bouncy House Village at the Adirondack Balloon Festival when presenting membership card
  * Company listing on Museum website, on Museum signage, and in Annual Report
  * Additional incentives as listed below

Native American Collection, 2007

[Download a Membership Form](https://worldchildrensmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/12/business-membership-application-2019.pdf)

## Supporter

$125

  * 1 one-year membership card
  * 2 complimentary admission passes
  * Listing of business name on website

## Friend

$250

  * 2 one-year membership cards
  * 5 complimentary admission passes
  * 25% off private Museum rental for 50 people
  * Listing of business name with hyperlink on website

## Business Club

$500

  * 2 one-year membership cards
  * 10 complimentary admission passes
  * 50% off private Museum rental for 50 people
  * Logo with hyperlink on Museum website

$1000

accessibility_text:
Accessibility Statement



**Accessibility Statement**

**World Awareness Children’s Museum Accessibility Statement**

Updated: May 2021

**General**

World Awareness Children’s Museum strives to ensure that its services are accessible to people with disabilities. World Awareness Children’s Museum has invested a significant amount of resources to help ensure that its website is made easier to use and more accessible for people with disabilities, with the strong belief that every person has the right to live with dignity, equality, comfort, and independence.

**Accessibility on World Awareness Children’s Museum**

World Awareness Children’s Museum makes available the [UserWay Website Accessibility Widget](https://userway.org/) that is powered by a dedicated accessibility server. The software allows our website to improve its compliance with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.1).

**Enabling the Accessibility Menu**

Our accessibility menu can be enabled by clicking the accessibility menu icon that appears on the corner of the page. After triggering the accessibility menu, please wait a moment for the accessibility menu to load in its entirety.

**Disclaimer**

World Awareness Children’s Museum continues its efforts to constantly improve the accessibility of its site and services in the belief that it is our collective moral obligation to allow seamless, accessible and unhindered use also for those of us with disabilities.
